data.title: The Hashemites
data.text:
Born on 30 January 1962, Abdullah II has been the reigning King of Jordan since February 1999. He's the son of King Hussein I and an Englishwoman Princess Muna. His consort is Queen Rania and they have 4 children. His Majesty enjoys scuba diving, sky diving, rally racing ans science fictions.

Born on 31 August 1970, Queen Rania al Abdullah is the wife of Abdullah II. She has Palestinian origins. They got married in 1993 and have 4 children. The queen supports women's rights and education. Her Majesty is also famous for her beauty and impeccable style.

Born on 28 June 1994, Crown Prince Hussein is the eldest child of King Abdullah II and Queen Rania. He became Crown Prince in 2009 and has 3 younger siblings. His interests include motorcycles & football. He is a graduate of Georgetown University and Royal Militay Academy Sandhurst. He is engaged to Rajwa Al Seif of a prominent Saudi family.

Born on born in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia on 28 April 1994, Rajwa is the wife of CP Hussein. Her father founded El Seif Engineering Contracting and the family is a descendant of the Subai tribe, who have been the sheikhs of Attar in Sudair, Najd. She holds a B.A. in architecture from Syracuse University’s School of Architecture & worked in Los Angeles before. She married Hussein in a grand wedding on 1 June 2023 and given the title of HRH Princess Rajwa Al Hussein.

Born on 27 September 1996, Princess Iman bint Abdullah is the second child of Abdullah II and Queen Rania. She sometimes appears along with her parents in public engagements. The princess studied Georgetown University's School of Foreign Service before switching to Parsons in New York. She married NY-based businessman Jameel Thermiotis at home on 12 March 2023.

Born on 26 September 2000, Princess Salma bint Abdullah is the third child of Abdullah II and Queen Rania. The princess was a student at International Academy Amman, one of her mother's many organisations. She graduated later from the Royal Military Academy Sandhurst and graduated from USC in Archaeology.

Born on 30 January 2005, Prince Hashem shares a birthday with his father Abdullah II. He's the youngest child in the family. The prince is a student at International Academy Amman, one of his mother's many organisations.

Born on 23 August 1951, Queen Noor was an American named Lisa Halaby. She is King Hussein I's fourth wife and married him in 1978. She was given the name "Noor al Hussein" upon marriage. Her Majesty has 4 children. Although she's also Jordan's queen dowager, she's not the biological mother of King Abdullah II.

Born on 29 March 1980, Prince Hamzah bin Hussein is the firstborn child of Hussein I and Queen Noor and the 9th child of Hussein I. Hamzah attended Sandhurst and Harvard. He was the Crown Prince from 1999 until 2004. He was married to Princess Noor and has 1 daughter. The prince is now married to Princess Basmah and they have 4 daughthers and 2 sons. He's been under house arrest since 2021.

Born in 1979, Princess Basmah is the 2nd wife of Prince Hamzah. She was a pilot and married Prince Hamzah in 2012. She has 3 daughters with him.

Born on 10 June 1981, Prince Hashim bin Hussein is the 10th child of Hussein I & Queen Noor's 2nd child. He attended Sandhurst, Duke and Georgetown University. Hashim is married with 3 daughters and 1 son. The prince is now working in the military.

Nothing much is known about Princess Fahdah. She's the wife of Prince Hashim and came from a prominent family in Saudi Arabia. She got married in 2006 and has 3 daughters and 1 son.

Born on 24 April 1983, Princess Iman bint Hussein is the daughter of King Hussein I and Queen Noor and Abdullah II"s half-sister. She attended Sandhurst and American University. The princess was one of the most eligible royals until she married Zaid Mirza in 2013.

Born on 9 February 1986, Raiyah bint Hussein is the youngest child of King Hussein and Queen Noor. The princess is now pursuing a PhD degree at UCLA. She is married to British journalist Ned Donovan since 2020.

Born on 3 May 1974, Haya is the daughter of King Hussein and his 3rd wife Queen Alia. The Oxford-graduate's also an equestrian athlete and participated in many games on behalf of Jordan. She was married to Sheikh Mohammed, the ruler of Dubai from 2004 to 2019. They had 2 children. After divorce, she is currently living in London with her children while serving at the Jordanian embassy.

Born on 23 December 1975, Prince Ali bin Al Hussein is the only son of Hussein I with Queen Alia. The prince has been one of FIFA's vice presidents since 2011. He mainly works with sports in Jordan. Ali is married to Princess Rym with 2 children.

Born in 1969, Princess Rym Ali is the daughter of a senior Algerian diplomat Lakhdar Brahimi, who works to the UN now. She's a journalist before marriage and has degrees from Sorbonne, SciencesPo and Columbia. She's married to Prince Ali and has 2 children. The princess is heavily involved in Jordanian film and media industry.

Born on 25 April 1941, Princess Muna al Hussein, born Antoinette Gardiner, is the 2nd wife of Hussein I and the biological mother of King Abdullah II. She was a British citizen by birth and married Hussein I in 1961. She has 4 children and is still living in Jordan.

Born on 11 October 1963, Feisal bin Al Hussein is the son of King Hussein and Princess Muna. The prince is also Abdullah II's only full brother. He was married to Alia Tabba with 4 children and to Sara Qabbani. His current wife is Princess Zeina al Feisal and they have 2 sons. Feisal is now serving the military and sometimes acts as a Regent.

Princess Zeina al Feisal is the daughter of a Jordanian businessman. She worked as a radio presenter before she became Prince Feisal's 3rd wife in 2014. She gave birth to a son, Prince Abdullah, in 2016.

Born on 11 February 1990, Princess Ayah bint Al Feisal is the eldest child of Prince Feisal with his first wife Alia Tabba. The princess was educated at the Amman Baccalaureate School and the SOAS, University of London. Ayah married Mohammad Halawani on 22 May, 2014 and they have two daughters, Raiyah (b. 2016) and Nesma (b. 2019).

Born on 22 October 1993, Prince Omar bin Al Feisal is the only son of Prince Feisal with his first wife Alia Tabba. The prince was educated at the Chapel Hill-Chauncy Hall School and is now studying in the UK.

Born on 27 March 1997, Princess Sara bint Al Feisal is one of the twin daughters of Prince Feisal with his first wife Alia Tabbaa. Like her twin sister, the princess graduated from Amman Baccalaureate School and the University of Westminster with a bachelor degree in Interior Architecture and a Master of Arts in Events Management and Design.

Born on 27 March 1997, Princess Aisha bint Al Feisal is one of the twin daughters of Prince Feisal with his first wife Alia Tabbaa. Like her twin sister, the princess graduated from Amman Baccalaureate School and the University of Westminster with a bachelor degree in Criminology & LLM in Religion, Law, and Society. She currently works at her father's initiative, Generations for Peace.

Born on 23 April 1968, Princess Aisha bint Al Hussein is the daughter of Hussein I and Princess Muna. She also has a twin sister called Zein. The princess has 2 children with her ex-husband. She is currently serving as a military attache in Jordan's embassy in Washington D.C. The princess is currently married to Ashraf Banayotti.

Born on 23 April 1968, Princess Zein bint Al Hussein is the daughter of Hussein I and Princess Muna. She also has a twin sister called Aisha. She is married and has 3 children.

Born on 13 February 1956, Alia is the firstborn child of King Hussein I and the only child between him and Princess Dina. The princess was educated in Amman and the UK before evetually graduated from the University of Jordan. She was married to Nasser Mirza from 1977-1988 with one son Hussein; she's now married to Mohammed Al Saleh and has 2 sons Talal & Abdul. Her interests are equestrianism, Arabian horses and animals.

Born Taghrid Majali, she's the daughter of late former Jordanian Prime Minister Hazza al Majali. She is the 2nd wife of Prince Mohammed and married him in 1981. Upon her marriage, she also has 2 stepsons Talal and Ghazi and together they adopted her niece, Samiha Al Fayez.

Born on 26 July 1965, Talal bin al Mohammed is the eldest son of Prince Mohammed and his 1st wife Princess Firyal. The prince attended Harrow School and Sandhurst in the UK and eventually graduated from Georgetown University's School of Foreign Service. He served under King Hussein and in the armed forces and is currently a Special Advisor to King Abdullah II. He's married to Princess Ghida and has 3 children: Hussein, Rajaa and Muhammad.

Born on 11 July 1963 in Lebanon, Ghida Talal (née Salaam) comes from a politically prominent family. She is a graduate of Georgetown University's School of Foreign Service and worked as a journalist before her marriage to Prince Talal. The princess is the Chairperson, Board of Trustees of King Hussein Cancer Foundation. She has three children.

Born on 15 October 1965, Ghazi bin al Mohammed is the youngest child of Prince Mohammed and 1st wife Firyal. He was educated in Harrow School, Princeton University, Cambridge and Al-Azhar University. Prince Ghazi works mainly in religious initiatives and is currently the Chief Advisor to King Abdullah II for Religious and Cultural Affairs and his Personal Envoy. He was married to Princess Areej bint Omar Al Zawawi and has 4 children: Tasneem, Jennah, Abdullah and Salsabil, before divorcing in 2021. He is now married to Princess Miriam, since 2022.

Princess Miriam al-Ghazi (also previously known as Miriam, Dowager Princess of Turnovo, Duchess in Saxony; née Miriam Ungría y López; born 2 September 1963) is a Spanish jewellery designer, and member of the Bulgarian and Jordanian royal families. Born a Spanish aristocrat, she was married to Kardam, Prince of Turnovi, heir apparent to the defunct Bulgarian throne from 1996 until his early death in 2015. They have 2 sons Princes Boris and Beltrán. In September 2022 she married Prince Ghazi bin Muhammad and retains her Orthodox faith.

Born on 20 March 1947, Prince Hassan is the youngest son of King Talal and Queen Zein & uncle of King Abdullah II. The Oxford-graduate served as the Crown Prince to his brother King Hussein I from 1965 until 1999. He is still an active working royal and promotes interfaith matters. He has been married to Pakistani Sarvath Ikramullah since 1968 and has 4 children: Rahma, Sumaya, Badiya and Rashid.

Born on 24 July 1947, Princess Sarvath (nee Ikramullah) is the daughter of a prominent Pakistani diplomat and politician. She was educated at Cambridge and married Prince Hassan in Karachi in 1968. She gave birth to 4 children: Rahma, Sumaya, Badiya and Rashid. She mainly works in the field of education, women and the family, social welfare and health. The princess is also the first Jordanian woman to obtain a Black Belt in Taekwondo.

Born on 13 August 1969, Rahma bint El Hassan is the firstborn child of Prince Hassan and Princess Sarvath. She graduated from Cambridge and married Alaa Batayneh in 1997. She has 2 children: Aysha and Arif.

Born on 14 May 1971, Sumaya is the 2nd child of Prince Hassan and his wife. She's a graduate of the Courtauld Institute of Art at the University of London. The princess mainly works in the field of science, technology and chairs the Board of Trustees of the Princess Sumaya University for Technology. She's also an archaeologist. Sumaya has 4 children with her ex-husband, Nasser Judeh, who's Jordan's current foreign minister.

Born on 28 March 1974, Badiya is the 3rd child of Prince Hassan. She studied at Oxford and the London School of Economics. The princess qualified as a barrister in 1998 and was called to the Bar at Lincoln's Inn. She promotes interfaith and cross-cultural understanding & human rights. She's married to Khaled Edward Blair and has 1 son.

Born on 20 May 1979, Prince Rashid is the only son of Prince Hassan and his wife. He's a graduate from Sandhurst and Cambridge. He's currently a Lieutenant Colonel in the Gendarmerie. In 2011, he married Zeina Shaban, a table-tennis champion, and has 1 son Hassan with her.

Born in 1988, Zeina Rashid (nee Shaban) is a table-tennis player and represented Jordan at the 2003 World Table Tennis Championships, the 2004 Summer Olympics and the 2008 Summer Olympics. She married Prince Rashid in 2011 and gave birth to a son Hassan in 2013.

Born on 11 May 1951, Princess Basma is the youngest child of King Talal and Queen Zein and an aunt of King Abdullah II. She studied Modern Languages at Oxford. She has 2 children, Farah & Ghazi, with 1st husband Timoor Daghistani. Princess Basma has been married to Walid al-Kurdi and has 2 more children. She mainly promotes promote human development, gender equity and children's charities.

Born on 27 April 1948, Prince Asem is the son of Prince Naif bin Abdullah, who's a younger son of King Abdullah & Princess Mihrimah Sultana Osmanoğlu, granddaughter of Sultan Mohammad Rashad of Turkey. He has his own business but also served some public organisations like SPANA. He has 3 daughters - Yasmine, Sarah, Noor - with 1st wife Firouzeh Vokhshouri. Prince Asem is now married to Princess Sana with 3 more children: Salha, Nejla and Nayef.

Born on 6 October 1982, Noor bint Asem is the 3rd child of Prince Asem and his 1st wife, who currently lives in Madrid. The princess has 5 siblings. She married Prince Hamzah (then Crown Prince Hamzah) in 2003 and gave birth to a daughter Haya in 2007. They divorced in 2009. In 2018, she married for the 2nd time, to Amr Zedan, a Saudi polo player. She and Zedan has 2 sons, Talal & Abdullah.

Born on 14 June 1987, Salha bint Asem is the 4th child of Prince Asem. Her mother Princess Sana is Prince Asem's second wife. The princess was educated in Amman, the US and the University of Edinburgh. She has 5 sibling, including 3 elder half-sisters. Princess Salha married Mohammad Haj-Hassan in 2011 and they have a daughter born in 2013 called Aisha.

Born on 9 May 1988, Nejla bint Asem is the 5th child of Prince Asem. Her mother Princess Sana is Prince Asem's second wife. The princess has 5 sibling, including 3 elder half-sisters. Princess Nejla was previously engaged once. She has been married to Nasser Osama Talhouni since October 2014. She has 2 daughters, named Kareemah and Shayma.

Born on 15 September 1964, Princess Alia Tabbaa is the daughter of Tawfik al-Tabbah, founder and president of Royal Jordanian Airlines. She studied International Relations at the University of Sussex. She married Prince Feisal in 1987 and has 4 children - Ayah, Omar, Sara & Aisha - with him. They divorced in 2008 but Alia was allowed to keep her title and still works for the royal family.

Born in 1945, Princess Firyal (nee Irshaid) is the daughter of a Jordanian politician. She married Prince Mohammed bin Talal in 1964 until 1978. She has 2 sons Talal and Ghazi with him. The princess mainly works for international organisations.

Born on 18 February 1936, Prince Raad is the son of Prince Zeid of the Hashemite House and Princess Fahrelnissa. He is first cousin of late King Talal and the Head of the Royal House of Iraq. He graduated from Cambridge and worked as an aide to Kings Hussein and Abdullah II. He has 5 children - Zeid, Mired, Firas, Faisal & Fakhrelnissa - with his Swedish-born wife Majda.

Born on 5 September 1942 in Sweden as Margaretha Inga Elisabeth Lind, Princess Majda Raad is the wife of Prince Raad and has 5 children with him.

Born on 26 January 1964, Prince Zeid is the eldest son of Prince Raad and his wife. He is now the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights. Prince Zeid previously served as Jordan's Permanent Representative to the UN. He married American Sarah Butler in 2000 and has 3 children, Raad, Hala & Azziza, with her.

Born on 1 August 1972 in Texas, Princess Sarah Zeid (née Butler) is the wife of Prince Zeid bin Raad. She previously worked for the United Nations. The princess has 3 children with her husband.

Born as Dina Khalifeh, Princess Dina Mired married Prince Mired in 1992 and has 3 children, Shirin, Rakan and Jafar. She has degrees at Warwick University and Reading University. The princess now works as the Director of King Hussein Cancer Foundation and speaks fluent Arabic and English, plus a working knowledge of French.

Born as Dana Nabil Touka, Princess Dana Firas married Prince Firas bin Ra'ad in 1993 and has 3 children, Safa, Haya & Hashem. She has bachelor's & masters' degrees from Boston University, the London School of Economics & Harvard University. An advocate of heritage preservation, sustainable development and responsible tourism, she is the President of Petra National Trust and UNESCO Goodwill Ambassador since 2017

Born in February 1882 in Mecca, Ottoman Empire, Abdullah, the first king of the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan, was the second son of Hussein bin Ali, the Sharif of Mecca. He had a key role in the Great Arab Revolt. Abdullah first ruled as the Emir of Transjordan and then King of an independent Jordan after 1946. The king was assasinated in 1951 while visiting the Al-Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem. He had 3 wives and his heir was his son Talal with his eldest wife.

Born on 26 February 1909 in the Ottoman Empire, Talal was the son of Jordan's first king Abdullah I and his 1st wife. He ruled the kingdom from 1951-1952, after the assasination of his father and only abdicated due to schizophrenia. He had 6 children with his wife Queen Zein, including King Hussein I.

Born on 14 November 1935, King Hussein I was the 3rd king of Jordan. He's also the father of current king Abdullah II. He was married 4 times and had 11 children. Nicknamed "Lion of Jordan", Hussein I was much-loved among his people. He died on 7 February 1999 and his widow's Queen Noor.

Born on 2 August 1916 in Egypt as Zein al-Sharaf, she married King Talal in 1934 and had 6 children with him, including King Hussein I. The queen worked with charitable works and women's rights.

Born on 15 December 1929, she was the first wife of King Hussein I and the mother of his eldest child Alia. Princess Dina was a member of the House of Hashemite. The aristocrat was educated in the UK and had a degree in English Literature at Cambridge. She was married to King Hussein from 1955-1957. She passed away in 2019, aged 89.

Born on 25 December 1948, Queen Alia was the 3rd wife of King Hussein I. She came from a Jordanian-Palestinian family. Alia became queen upon her marriage to Hussein I in 1972 and she gave birth to 2 children and adopted 1 daughter. The first active Jordanian queen consort, she was interested in social welfares for women and children. She passed away in a helicopter crash in 1977. Queen Alia International Airport was named after her.
